posts.text:
The best financial decision I made last year was to buy crypto.
Today, Etherium has hit 3750$, which I bought at around 2000$

One guy kept on saying: "Hamza thora thora etherium lete raho"
All thanks to Adnan bhai for being a mentor and an elder brother. 🙌

𝗜 𝗱𝗼𝗻’𝘁 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝘄𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝘁 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴.
And I’m perfectly okay with that.

You might be better than me
At podcasting.
At directing.
At dressing.

I’m happy for you, truly. But it doesn’t bother me.
Because I know what game I’m here to play.

When it comes to my work, content creation, brand building, building systems, I don’t let myself lose.

You can win all the races.
But in my race, I make sure I win.

Because losing the other 99% doesn’t change anything.
But winning the one race that matters to me?
That changes everything.

So, you don’t need to be great at everything.
Just figure out which race is yours, then go all in.

Karachi walon!
I’m in your city.
Excited for the biggest launch of the summer for our collaboration with BYD Pakistan for Shark 6.🦈

See you all tomorrow at Expo Centre Karachi.

𝗜’𝗺 𝗝𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗚𝗲𝗻 𝗭.
There, I said it.

When I was 16:
– YouTube didn’t have “masterclasses.”
– LinkedIn was a boring CV dump.
– Instagram was for selfies and sunset pictures.
– Freelancing meant fixing my uncle’s printer.

Forget ChatGPT, Notion, or Canva
AI tools? We barely had stable WiFi.

But here’s the thing:
If you’re a Gen Z reading this
You have the ultimate cheat codes.
The tools are free.
The world is connected.

Use what you have. Build relentlessly.
This is your time.
Don’t scroll it away.

A question for Overseas Pakistanis who left the country to work in the Middle East/ UK/ US/ other countries.

Was moving abroad worth it? How has your experience been so far? What's better abroad as compared to Pak?

I am conducting some research for a video, and your honest feedback would be greatly appreciated.

𝗜𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂'𝗿𝗲 𝟮𝟱+, 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝗮 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗮𝘁 𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗲𝘁.

Because let’s be honest, no one ever taught us how to budget, save, or manage recurring payments.

So here’s a quick breakdown to get you started:

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗕𝘂𝗱𝗴𝗲𝘁:
Track spending for 30 days in one place.
Follow the 50:30:20 rule:
50% Must-Haves: Rent, food, bills.
30% Future Money: Saving, investing, paying loans.
20% Fun Money: Entertainment, shopping, eating out.

𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗕𝗮𝗻𝗸 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗦𝗲𝘁𝘂𝗽:
Main Account (50%) - for daily needs/bills
Growth Account (30%) - for investments and savings
Spending Account (20%) - for personal wants
Safety Fund: Separate savings with 6 months of expenses

𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗥𝗲𝗴𝘂𝗹𝗮𝗿 𝗣𝗮𝘆𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀:
Keep all subscriptions in one view
Set low balance reminders
Group expenses (food/travel/home)
Sort transactions by trips or projects
Plan important payments to avoid late fees

𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗼𝗻 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝗠𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗔𝘃𝗼𝗶𝗱:
Forgetting to cancel unused subscriptions
Not checking your monthly spending summary
Planning next month's budget too late
Missing refunds in your money flow
Overlooking small repeat expenses that add up.

𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻 > 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺
There, I said it.

Why, you ask?
That’s the same question I’ve been asking myself for the past one year. I finally have the answer.

I have over half a million people who follow me on Instagram. I make all my money on Instagram. But there’s one thing Instagram doesn’t have:

That is our LinkedIn community.

That is people who want to learn something, who want to progress in life, who want to share their success stories, who want to inspire others, who comment "CFBR" to help strangers they have never met.

I haven’t met 99% of you, and yet I deeply feel so connected with all of you.

At the end, it’s all of us together who make this the best platform on social media.

Soch raha hoon LinkedIn HR recruiter ban jaoun.
Paisa he paisa hoga.

🌍: “Linkedin is a serious platform.”
🇵🇰 LinkedIn: “Hold my Rooh Afza…

Hamza Bhatti and Crumble.
Incase you are wondering about our relationship, toh we are friends with benefits. (Halal walay) ;)

Also I have shares in Crumble 😝

Dear Pakistani Brands,
This is what you’re sleeping on.

Linkedin is an organic awareness super-weapon.
Imagine Eight Hundred Thousand people watching you in a week here. Who have 10x buying power and the attention of Instagram.

It’s a Goldmine now and it wont stay like this forever.

Act now and give me your money. 💰

Crumble is back on Instagram.

#HawayiFiring 🍾🎉

𝗛𝗮𝗺𝘇𝗮 𝗯𝗵𝗮𝗶, 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘄𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗱𝗼𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝟭𝟴?

When I was 18, I was struggling with my studies.
I had just 300 rupees in my bank account and even less clarity in life.

But the Gen Z I see today?
• 16-year-olds selling insane video editing skills.
• 15-year-olds running full-blown crochet businesses.
• 13-year-olds selling copy like pros.

They think in numbers.
They question the norm.
They face resistance and still move forward.
And they do not care what anyone thinks.

They’re not trying to beat others. They’re trying to outgrow their past self.
And let me tell you, you can’t beat someone who thinks like that.

Proud to announce that I made my morning office chai myself today.

#JustLinkedinThings

Random 10 pm thought:
Who's the CEO of Pakistani linkedin for you? 🤔

Hello everyone,

Does any of you work or know someone who's in the Islamabad Chamber of Commerce?

I am in urgent need of a membership there. Any help would be appreciated.

Humaray Aba ne time par Haier, Dawlance ya Gree mein shares le liye hotay kaash.

Toh aaj mein LinkedIn posts nahi, balkay Karachi Turtle beach kai kisi villa mein apne pool kai kinaray beth kar pina colada pi raha hota. :')

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿'𝘀 𝗝𝗼𝘂𝗿𝗻𝗲𝘆.

This journey is by you and about you. It's about showing up at work every day, no matter what you are going through. It's about believing in yourself when no one believes in you. You will be cheered and booed. You will be hated upon and ridiculed by the very people who you thought supported you.

Eventually, when you rise to the top, the same people will claim that they were your biggest fans. A time will come when all of your self-doubt will disappear and you will inspire millions.

One day, you will realize that you have become your own biggest fan.
That day, you will become unstoppable.

UK E-visas for Pakistanis, finally! 👏🏻

Great to hear this news. Hopefully, this opens the door for e-visas in other categories as well.

British High Commission in PakistanJane Marriott CMG OBE Tulin Khalid Azim

𝗣𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗮 𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱𝘄𝗶𝗱𝗲 𝗹𝗮𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗵 𝗼𝗳 𝗩𝗶𝘃𝗼’𝘀 𝗕𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗫𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗙𝗘.
We introduced a new kind of typography in the reel that has never been done before. Hoping to raise the bar a bit higher every time.

Muhammad Zohair Chohan | vivo Pakistan

Shoutout to all my brand managers and corporate people working with Seths.

Know that you’re appreciated and loved. 🥰

#AikPappiider #AikPappiUder

𝗦𝗲𝗹𝗳-𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴.
It’s a survival skill in 2025.

If you’re not actively showing your value, you’ll get overlooked.
Nobody’s sitting around thinking about your contributions.
- Not your boss.
- Not your clients.
- Not even your team.

If they don’t know what you’re doing, they assume you’re doing nothing.

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳-𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 (𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘀𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄-𝗼𝗳𝗳):
• Post your insights and wins on LinkedIn
• Share project updates regularly with your team
• Speak up in meetings
• Start or contribute to meaningful conversations
• Highlight emerging trends and how you’re responding

Invisible effort doesn’t get rewarded.
Visible value does.

I'm looking for an international card to make international payments.
Could someone suggest what works best in Pakistan?

𝗧𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗸𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗴𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱 𝗮𝘁.

1. Stop expecting too much from yourself
2. Take your time. It's not a race.
3. Experiment as much as you can and don't be afraid to fail.
4. Try to acquire multiple skills that are relevant.
𝗟𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗵𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗼𝗱𝘀𝗽𝗸!

𝗜 𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝟯𝟲𝟱 𝗱𝗮𝘆𝘀.
Result → 25 MILLION+ impressions.

Here’s how I did it:
Consistency + Strategy = Compounding Growth.

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗜 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁:
Every weekend, I sit down and list 7–10 content ideas on one sheet.
I write rough drafts and select a relevant image.
If a post needs design work, I get it done in advance.
I schedule them to avoid daily pressure or burnout.

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗜 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘇𝗲:
I follow 3 core content pillars that define my niche.
I map out themes for each day of the week.
For example:
- Monday = High-value insights
- Tuesday = Content creation tips
- Wednesday = Personal story or POV
...and so on.
This helps me stay focused, relevant, and intentional.

𝗖𝗮𝗻 𝗔𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗗𝗼 𝗜𝘁?
YES. If I can do it, so can you.
But here’s the catch:
Consistency means posting with purpose, structure, and clarity.

Start small. Build a system. Stick with it.
Your 365 days could change everything, too.

[𝗣𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘀𝗲𝗱]

Looking to connect with professionals who manage LinkedIn profiles.
If that’s you, feel free to drop a message!

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗱𝗼 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱:

Have an AI-generated profile picture. You are dealing with humans here, not robots.

This isn't Terminator 3.
Mojooda Surat-e-Haal 💅

I officially declare that this is "PEAK LINKEDIN"

3 years down the line we will remember how great this platform was.

𝗝𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝟯𝟲 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗽𝘀, 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝘆 𝟰 𝗽𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗱𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗱 𝗳𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗸 𝗧𝗮𝗻𝗸 𝗣𝗮𝗸𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻.

Hoping there’s a justifiable reason behind it because the show sparked genuine hope for a stronger, more resilient startup ecosystem in Pakistan. Would be disheartening to see that momentum fade.
Sub kuch manzoor hai par mujhe email mein "DEAR" kehnay walon kai saath JUNG HAI.

𝗘𝘅𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗹𝘆 𝘂𝗻𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗽𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝘀𝗲𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗲-𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗮𝘅𝗲𝘀.
Temu and AliExpress had become my go-to for camera gear and tech. For the first time ever, there was a ray of hope that I wouldn't have to go through the hassle of importing everything from abroad.

Daraz and other local e-commerce platforms are nowhere close when it comes to variety and quality.

What happens now?
